JUDGES: András Sajó;Iulia Motoc;Krzysztof Wojtyczek;Marko Bošnjak;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Gabriele Kucsko-Stadlmayer
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The NORP Government ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON of ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant married A. They have CARDINAL children , born in DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant began a relationship with ORG , his supervisor at work . In DATE the applicant moved out of the flat he had lived in with his family . At the request of his children he attempted to reconcile with PERSON and later moved back in for a week . However , he subsequently decided to continue his relationship with ORG
CARDINAL . Since DATE he has been living with GPE , her CARDINAL children and her grandson .
CARDINAL . On DATE applied for child maintenance .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant to pay MONEY ( ORG ) per month for his CARDINAL children ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a petition for divorce . He asked the court to declare that both parties were at fault for the breakdown of the marriage .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to grant the divorce . It found that PERSON was a very good mother and wife and was not at fault for the breakdown of the marriage . She still loved her husband and was ready to forgive him for his affair . The court stressed that the applicant was the only person responsible and at fault for the breakdown of his marriage , and referred to the fact that his wife had not agreed to a divorce . It was decided that a divorce was not legally permitted in their case . Lastly , the court referred to the fact that the applicant ’s CARDINAL children were still minors and held that a divorce would not be in their best interests .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the firstinstance judgment , holding that the applicant ’s wife was not at fault for the breakdown of the marriage . The judgment subsequently became final . A cassation appeal in ORG was not available .
CARDINAL . On DATE initiated a new set of proceedings . She applied to ORG for a formal separation from the applicant . She also sought the payment of child maintenance .
CARDINAL . In a written reply of CARDINAL DATE the applicant did not agree to a separation and asked the court to declare the parties divorced .

CARDINAL . During a hearing of CARDINAL DATE agreed to a divorce at the applicant ’s exclusive fault . The applicant declared that he was at fault and agreed to the arrangements for child maintenance proposed by A.
CARDINAL . Consequently , by a judgment of CARDINAL DATE the marriage was dissolved . Neither party appealed . The judgment was final .
